column4: I shared internet with Firestarter, took me a while to get it sorted out...
ifconfig says Eth0 is up
how else would I start the interface?
ok, what do I give it?
ok, I did ifconfig eth0 192.168.0.1
ok, set up the IP address for the second card.  What next?
apparently the share is up now after running the wizard again, but Roku isn't detecting an ethernet connection
ok, pretend it's an Xbox
is that Firestarter?
the way I see it, the whole problem revolves around not being able to set up a connection profile on the second card
dhcpd?  not in aptitude
you mean dhcpcd?
ok, that's installed, then stopped and restarted Firestarter
but I'm guessing I have to do something with that dhcpcd, right?
ok, how do I do that?
talk to me like I'm a n00b, which I am
yeah, just saw that.  am looking at Jonathan Moeller's page
do I need to add a static DNS server as well?
ok.  Well, tried restarting network manager, then tried to connect Roku, still no luck
even worse, now it says the device isn't managed after making those weird additions to /etc/network/interfaces
crossover cable?  when I had this working before it got all borked up, I didn't need a crossover cable
as I said, the whole critical problem with this is that as before I could set up a  connection profile under network connections with my second card, I can't now, and I think Lucid is the problem
thought so.  Maybe an update addresses this?  I guess I'll just have to wait until I can get the computer set up to what it was before I wiped it, and then update it
otherwise, I may think of screaming to Canonical about how they screwed up network connection management in Lucid
